RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Claiming Purse 29000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IT'S EASY bumped several times right after the start, assumed a forward position, disputed the pace being rated towards the two path, poked a head down in front to lead the field into the stretch, was almost a sixteenth down the road before getting switched over to encouragement, drifted out slightly but drew off, kept busy to the end. HOT ON ICE vied for the lead from near the inside to upper stretch, got shaken off, held on well enough to secure second. PEACH LAKE lost the three path to LADY SEEKER midpoint on the turn, took the fourth one for entrance into the stretch already having been asked for run, proved no match. DANCE FOR JOE saved ground throughout and failed to menace. LADY SEEKER bumped a few times in rapid succession from between rivals at the start, tipped into the three tip path at the three-eighths pole, entered the stretch just as wide, gave way. YACANTMAKETHISUP bumped at the start, was urged along chasing the front runners from the three path on the bend, folded.

ENTRY.NAME: Dance for Joe
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground throughout, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Hot On Ice
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied near inside, held well place

ENTRY.NAME: It's Easy
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump start,rated 2p,asked upper,drifted out bit,kept busy & clear

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Seeker
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumps btwn start, tip 3p 3/8, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Yacantmakethisup
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump start,urged 3w turn, folded

ENTRY.NAME: Peach Lake
ENTRY.COMMENT: lost 3p 3/8, urged 4w into lane, no match

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 106. Purse 53000. (UP TO $9,540 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $32,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING OR STARTER IN 2014 OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $32,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs. ; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since February 1, 2014 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $32,000 (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NON STOP on the track before the rest of the post parade arrived, was also the first to get loaded into the starting gate, isolated from the others during the process, came away without apparent mishap, vied for the lead from the two path, patiently handled, challenged in earnest as the front runners headed into the stretch, responded positively when given its cue shortly afterwards and kicked away. BOWMAN'S BEAST argued for command along the inside put to a prolonged drive, narrowly held the place. SMALL TOWN TALK brushed at the start, took up the chase from the two path on the turn, rallied for the show. DYKER BEACH four wide on the turn, got outfinished. MY ADONIS devoid of speed down the backstretch, picked it up after entering the turn, raced primarily from the two path, rallied belatedly to grab the last major check. BROAD RULE three wide behind the contested pace, tired. DIVINE CHILD made light contact with SMALL TOWN TALK, quickly tucked along the rail, was pulling with noticeable force on the bit for most of the way to the half mile pole, faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Bowman's Beast
ENTRY.COMMENT: argued inside, long drive, held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Non Stop
ENTRY.COMMENT: on track early,vied 2p,let out upper, kicked away

ENTRY.NAME: Broad Rule
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w behind fuel, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Dyker Beach
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w on turn, lacked needed response

ENTRY.NAME: Divine Child
ENTRY.OWNER: Servis, Jason and Cassella, Daniel A.
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush start, rode rail,pulled bit early, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Small Town Talk
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush start, chased 2p, rallied for show

ENTRY.NAME: My Adonis
ENTRY.COMMENT: devoid speed back,2p turn,belatedly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 28000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners of a race since February 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OKEY DOKEY SMOKEY broke in at the start bumping with COLDWATER FLAT, chased that foe from just off the inside in aim, came under encouragement at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide for home seizing command straightened away into upper stretch, edged away under a drive to prevail. KELTIC FIGHTER just off the pace chasing three wide, came under urging midway on the turn, angled six wide into upper stretch, chased the winner home to secure the place honors while offering no extra. SHOUTOUT two to three wide towards the rear, got put to a ride three furlongs out, spun four wide into upper stretch, weakened in the drive while safe for the show. SUNRISE LOVER hard to load, chased three wide from mid pack under a prolonged drive from the half mile pole, angled five wide at the quarter pole, weakened. SELDOM SEEN SLIM tracked the pace along the inside in mid pack, came under a ride midway on the turn, spun two to three wide for home, tired. MASTER YANK outrun in the early going, grew detached from the main body of the field, got put to encouragement at the half mile pole, angled three wide for home, made no impact while closing some ground late on. COLDWATER FLAT bumped at the start while under hustling by OKEY DOKEY SMOKEY when that rival broke inwards, got ridden along on the pace inside through solid splits, succumbed the front straightening away three wide into upper stretch and folded, the rider placing his charge to a protective hold through the final eighth.

ENTRY.NAME: Master Yank
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun early, detached and last, 3w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Coldwater Flat
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, hustled st, pushed along ins, headed 1/4p, folded

ENTRY.NAME: Okey Dokey Smokey
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb, Michael, Bethlehem Stables LLC and Sahn, Robert I.
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in st, chased 2p in aim, asked 5/16, 4w upper, edged away

ENTRY.NAME: Seldom Seen Slim
ENTRY.OWNER: Fortuna Mia Stable and Lodico Richard
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside mid pack, urged 3/8, 2-3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Keltic Fighter
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace chasing 3w, urged 3/8, 6w upper, no extra

ENTRY.NAME: Shoutout
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w towards rear, urged 3/8, 4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Sunrise Lover
ENTRY.COMMENT: hard to load, 3w mid pack, long drive, 5w upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 116. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 85000. (UP TO $15,300 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON $25,000 TWICE AT A MILE OR OVER IN 2014 OR OPTIONAL CLAIM ING PRICE OF $80,000. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Since February 1, 2014 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $80,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(Non-starters For A Claiming Price Of $25,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the main track.) (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DAWLY brushed at the start, settled into midpack, chased the front runners from the two path on the turn, needed strong encouragement by midpoint on the bend to keep at the task, was guided over to the inside route during the final stages of run around the bend, had ample room along the rail corridor to launch a rally and did just that, took over by start of the final furlong and edged away. INTEGRITY brushed at the start, stalked the pace from the two path, continued onward in a willing manner to garner the place. PASS THE DICE vied for control from a slight distance from off the rail, got set down for the drive, drifted into the two path at the top of the lane, yielded to the winner then weakened in the final furlong. DON DULCE brushed from both sides at the break, was put to some encouragement nearly from the get-go, raced three wide on the turn, was put to a drive by the five-sixteenths marker, had no rally. PRAETEREO brushed at the start, raced towards the inside to the quarter pole, trailed throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Praetereo
ENTRY.OWNER: Drawing Away Stable and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush start, near inside, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Pass the Dice
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied near inside,drifted 2p top of lane, weakened final furlong

ENTRY.NAME: Dawly
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb, Michael, Bethlehem Stables LLC and Aisquith, Gary
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush st,2p & rouse 3/8,duck to ins,clear rail rally 1/4,clear

ENTRY.NAME: Don Dulce
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush both sides start,urged early,3w,drive by 5/16,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Integrity
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush start,stalked 2p,willingly for place

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Purse 77000. INNER TURF (UP TO $13,860 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $10,000 ONCE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-w inners of a race other than Claiming, or Starter at a mile or over since February 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A race other than Claiming, or Starter at any distance since then Allowed 4 lbs. (Non-starters For A Claiming Price Of $25,000 Or Less In The Last 3 StartsP referred). (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: C C'S PRIDE three wide in pursuit, came under encouragement nearing the quarter pole, swung four wide for home, rallied to take over narrowly a furlong out, inched away kept to task. GET GORGEOUS prompted the pace three to four wide to the three-eighths, seized command near the five-sixteenths, swung just off the inside for home, dug in and was headed a furlong out, ran on clear of the rest and second best. PRAYED FOR cut the pace two to three wide under some pressure to the outside, got displaced near the five-sixteenths, cut the corner into upper stretch and weakened. EVIDENTLY chased the pace along the inside, got let out spinning just off the inside into the stretch, weakened in the drive. LONG BLOOMING ROSE coaxed along three to four wide in pursuit, took the overland route briefly midway on the turn, angled in to be three wide at the head of the stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Evidently
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, let out 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Prayed For
ENTRY.COMMENT: cut pace 2-3w, headed 5/16, cut corner, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: C C's Pride
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, asked near 1/4p, 4w upper, up 1/8p, inched away

ENTRY.NAME: Get Gorgeous
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 3-4w to 3/8, up near 5/16, headed 1/8p, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Long Blooming Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-4w pursuit coaxed along, overland 3/8, 3w upper, tired

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of LIN

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 86. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. (UP TO $13,500 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs. (Non-starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: READY FOR RYE away in good order, raced side by side with UNLOCK THE GLORY during the initial stages, shook free and took up residence in the two path, sailed along on an open lead, saw the field close in somewhat after backing down the second split, was put to a drive spinning into the stretch, scampered away, kept to encouragement until the final seventy yards. MAWTHOOQ got squeezed back after getting involved in a jostling contest right after the field had been sent on its way, chased the winner taking the overland route on the turn, entered the stretch and went on to be second best. FURYOFTHENORSEMEN broke to the inside after leaving the starting gate, traded several light bumps with the runner up a s result, travelled three to four wide on the bend, got outfinished and had to settle for the show. KICK OFF underwent a ground-saving journey and bested the rest. BLACKWATER CHARLY brushed at the start, stumbled immediately afterwards, was sent over to the inside route well before reaching the end of the backstretch, cut the corner into the stretch having been put to a full drive, faltered. SARATOGA WILDCAT jostled at the break, took up the chase from the two path on the turn, gave way. UNLOCK THE GLORY sparred with the winner on nearly even terms during much of the opening furlong, got shaken off, moved to be outside the top one as the first fraction was being set, raced two to three wide on the turn, was through before going a half and backed away.

ENTRY.NAME: Unlock the Glory
ENTRY.COMMENT: spar with winner early,2-3w turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Kick Off
ENTRY.COMMENT: ground-saving journey, bested the rest

ENTRY.NAME: Blackwater Charly
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush,stumble brk,quick to rail,cut corner driving, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Saratoga Wildcat
ENTRY.COMMENT: jostled break,2p turn,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Mawthooq
ENTRY.COMMENT: jostlled,squeeze break,overland route,2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Furyofthenorsemen
ENTRY.COMMENT: came in,light bumps st,3-4w on turn, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Ready for Rye
ENTRY.COMMENT: sailed near 2p,rosued into lane,geared down final 70 yards

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Soc. Agr. Santa Elena De ChimbarongoLTDA

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 92. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. (UP TO $13,500 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. (Non-starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the main track.) (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHECKUPFROMZNECKUP coaxed lightly on the pace inside, came under pressure through the turn from a pair to the outside, got asked nearing the quarter pole, cut the corner into upper stretch, turned back those two challenges to edge clear to the wire. SILVERAMA reluctant to load, chased just off the inside in range of the front, came under urging at the five-sixteenths, swung four to five wide into upper stretch, kept on to garner the place. STRUM two to three wide at the rear, came under prolonged encouragement at the half mile pole, angled five to six wide into upper stretch, improved position for the show honors while making no headway on the front. SYLVIA T prompted the pace from just off the inside between foes, intensified the pressure through the turn coming under urging at the five-sixteenths, floated three wide into the stretch and weakened in the drive. COLORFUL three wide in pursuit in close range early on, intensified the pressure to press three wide through the turn under a ride from the three-eighths the outermost of a trio stacked across the track heads apart for command at the head of the stretch, spun four wide at that juncture floated out a bit by SYLVIA T, and weakened in the stretch. QUEEN'S PARADE just off the pace chasing inside under coaxing, got put to a drive midway on the turn in retreat, cut the corner for home and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Queen's Parade
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace chasing ins, asked 3/8, faded, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Checkupfromzneckup
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb, Michael, Bethlehem Stables LLC and Sahn, Robert I.
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed on pace ins, asked near 1/4, cut corner, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Strum
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w at rear, urged 1/2p, 5-6w upper, improved, no headway

ENTRY.NAME: Sylvia T
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 2p between foes, asked 5/16, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Silverama
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant to load, chased 2p, asked 5/16, 4-5w 1/4, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Colorful
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, pressed turn, asked 3/8, 4w upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Knickerbocker S. - Grade3 BELMONT PARK RACE 8 1 1/8M Inner turf CR: 119. Stakes Purse 200000. INNER TURF FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS AND UPWARD.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LEGENDARY (GB) took up position in midpack in the two path after the start, was patiently ridden keeping watch on the pacesetter, not close enough to make his presence felt though, was let out a notch and closed the gap readily from the five-sixteenths marker, turned for home set down to a full drive, took over in short order, emerged from the eighth pole pole holding its biggest advantage, dug in well enough long enough to preserve the decision. UP WITH THE BIRDS one-paced in the two path all the way to the half mile pole, picked up interest when asked to leaving that station, swung four wide into the stretch, charged down the center of the course with good energy en route to procuring the place. MSHAWISH took up the chase being two wide, was let out at the top of the lane, mustered up a mild response to grab the show award. PLAINVIEW broke on top and maintained control, was coaxed along showing the way from the inside on a loosely-contested lead, continued along under the same conditions until the last stages of the run around the second bend, faced a stiff challenge heading home and was put to a drive in response to it, succumbed shortly afterwards and backed away. SPEAKING OF WHICH (IRE) tracked the front runners saving ground to the quarter pole, got placed three wide at the head of the stretch, had no offering. WINNING CAUSE pursued the leader while taking the inside route, needed stronger and stronger encouragement past the half mile pole to continue at the chore, angled into the two path entering the stretch, had little left and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Plainview
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside,coaxed on lead,tested 1/4,succumbed

ENTRY.NAME: Winning Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, asked for run past 1/2,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Speaking of Which (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: track inside to 1/4,placed 3w upper,had no response

ENTRY.NAME: Legendary (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalk 2p afar,crept up from 5/16,driven into lane,drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Up With the Birds
ENTRY.COMMENT: one-pace 2p,pick up interest 2nd,4w into lane,good energy for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Mshawish
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, let out top of lane, mild kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 9 1M Dirt CR: 96. Claiming Purse 40000. (UP TO $7,200 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over since February 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (Winners Preferred). (If the S tewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the main track.) (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VONA coaxed two to three wide in close aim of the leader, took closer order taking command near the quarter pole, swung four wide for home, edged clear under a drive kept busy to the end. OLD UPSTART showed the way in hand just off the inside attended to the outside by the aforementioned foe, came under urging as that rival challenged in earnest nearing the quarter pole, got headed and swung three wide for home, proved unable to match strides with the top one while well clear of the rest and second best. SUNNYSIDER three wide in range of the front, came under prolonged coaxing from the half mile pole, angled five wide into upper stretch, was along for the show honors while weakening in the drive. CHASIN CHAMA chased the pace two to three wide under prolonged urging from the seven-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch and tired. MARCH REWARD lost his footing at the start stumbling as his hind quarters slipped, raced off the inside detached at the rear and trailed throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Chasin Chama
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace 2p, urged 7/16, 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Old Upstart
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand on pace 2p, urged near 1/4, headed, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Sunnysider
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w in range, coaxed 1/2p, 5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: March Reward
ENTRY.COMMENT: lost footing, stumbled st, off inside, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Vona
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed 2-3w in close aim, up 4w upper, edged clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 10 6F Dirt CR: 83. Maiden Claiming Purse 49200. INNER TURF (UP TO $7,380 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (Non-starters For A Claiming Price Of $16,000 Or Less In The Last Start Preferred). (Rail at 9 feet).

CLAIM.OWNER: Ramsey, Kenneth L. and Sarah K.

RACE.FOOTNOTES: POLITICAL FARCE bumped soundly from both sides at the start, was forced inward, recovered and settled into stride, entered the turn from the four path, exited it just as wide, responded eagerly when called upon, took charge before all the way through the furlong grounds, drew well clear in the last eighth. JIMMY FILLPOT bobbled over the wet going after being released from the gate, checked after being bumped hard right afterwards, took up the chase on VOTER TURNOUT from the two path, inherited the lead when that opponent made a mad dash over towards the outer fence midway on the turn, got set down for the drive, proved no match when confronted by the winner, finished willingly enough to remain far ahead of the others for the place. VOTER TURNOUT was one of many bumping with each other after the field had been sent on its way, glided by LITTLE T. LOUIE to take command, starting to display an inclination to bear out by the nine-sixteenths pole, was still comfortably in the clear when he bolted soon after entering the turn, staged a good comeback to claim the show award. BYRON'S POP unscathed at the break, one of only two entitled to make that claim, raced three wide on the turn, lacked the necessary stretch response. LITTLE T. LOUIE got away without incident at the start, saved ground and tired. HARD FAST CASH bumped solidly from between rivals at the start, began and ended the run around the bend being four wide, commenced the stretch run already being asked for a response, failed to do so. YES I'M TRUE bumped from each end, bobbled after getting pushed slightly towards the inside, was three wide midpoint on the turn, was in the five path by the head of the stretch, made no impact. MOONSILVER slammed at the start, went on to save ground to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: Jimmy Fillpot
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb, M., Bethlehem Stables LLC, Sahn, R., Akman, S. and AWC Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobble,bump,check start,2p,inherit lead,far in front 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Byron's Pop
ENTRY.COMMENT: unscatched break,chased 3w, lacked needed response

ENTRY.NAME: Little T. Louie
ENTRY.OWNER: Palombini, Charles J. and Catalano, Anthony
ENTRY.COMMENT: clean start, saved ground, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Moonsilver
ENTRY.COMMENT: slammed at start, rode rail, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Yes I'm True
ENTRY.OWNER: Missile Approved Racing and Dalchand, Loumas R.
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump between,push in bit,bobble start,3w 3/8,5w upper,outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Political Farce
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump btwn start,4w into & out of turn, took over,drew away

ENTRY.NAME: Hard Fast Cash
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped btwn start,4w top turn,urged 4w into lane, no headway

ENTRY.NAME: Voter Turnout
ENTRY.OWNER: Antonucci, Jena M. and NLG Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump st,bearing out 9/16,bolted on turn,good comeback for show
